body.p: Following is the reference architecture for SRIOV deployment in NFV 6.0:

ol.li: Dell NFV SRIOV architecture provides wireline speed to the virtual appliances running on a Dell Redhat NFV solution 6.0.
Dell NFV architecture is powered by IntelÂ®X520 dual port 10G NIC adaptors.

Dell NFV SRIOV scripts provides following functionalities in fully automated fashion:
Enablement of Virtual Functions in Compute nodes
Assigning Bandwidth limits to each virtual function
Assigning virtual functions to VMs running in OpenStack
Creating Physical Function pairs to provide NIC level redundancy
bonding

image.alt: SRIOV with HA Reference Architecture using NFV 6.0

ol.li: In addition to standard NFV 6.0 hardware, SRIOV enablement requires additional hardware, i.e. Intel X520, SFP, QSFP connectors, and fiber breakout cables, details can be found in next sections.

In addition to default networks of NFV 6.0, SRIOV enablement will require additional networks (VLANs) to communicate between physical functions and physical switch. Please refer to network diagram in next section.
SRIOV also requires one external network that can communicate to external datacenter. Detailed network topology is provided in next section.
